ygData.subject: Re: Dreams.
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron appeared to have fallen into an extremely light sleep, her hand gently resting on Dinobot’s upper arm. She had promised herself she wouldn’t move

Tavatron appeared to have fallen into an extremely light sleep, her hand 
gently resting on Dinobot�s upper arm. She had promised herself she wouldn�t 
move from this position until he either stopped breathing or woke up. She 
didn�t break her promises. With a heavy sigh Tavatron slightly stirred, her 
eyes opening in nearly invisible slits. She tightened her grip slightly on 
Dinobot�s arm, no matter what happened he would always be her friend. A 
warrior lived for the present, therefore the future had never really 
concerned Tavatron, but now�

No, she was being foolish again. He was her friend, nothing more. Slag, he 
wouldn�t even let her touch him half the time! Maybe that was why she had 
her hand on his arm, perhaps she was hoping he would wake up just to tell 
her to stop worrying. A sudden, horrific thought crossed the wolf-�bot�s 
mind:

*What if he didn�t wake up?*

The room seemed to spin  momentarily while Tavatron leaned forward, her 
hands clasped tightly about the edge of the table before her. The 
realization of what she once considered the impossible had chilled her to 
say the least:

"No."

A low, defiant growl hissed through wolven teeth answered the unthinkable. 
Tavatron leaned back in her chair and wiped the sweat from her eyes. He was 
a fighter. Death wasn�t an option.

The low grumbling of an empty stomach reminded her she hadn�t eaten for 
quite a while. The feeling of emptiness in her gut was enough to distract 
her for the time being. When Dinobot woke up perhaps they could go hunting. 
Their last excursion had been cut short by an emergency at the Ark. Now, 
however, they should be able to steal a couple of mega-cycles for a good 
hunt. The thought of hunting, of weaving betwixt hollow trees and leaping 
over fallen ones made the cold, harsh reality of the CF a little more 
bearable. The room blurred and blackened before Tavatron�s optics as she 
drifted in and out of conscience.

A banging of metal and scraping of claws awakened Tavatron from her partial 
slumber. Dinobot was moving! Now fully awake Tavatron stood beside him and 
waited for the convulsions to cease. A look of surprise and then relief 
flashed across her face. The sudden noise from his internal computer caused 
her to reflexively pull back her ears in an attempt to dull the sound. It 
seemed everything was more or less in working order, including Dinobot�s 
much needed repair system.

Tavatron watched in child-like wonder as Dinobot�s spark cavity�s door slid 
back to reveal the pulsating light within. The soft glow of Dinobot�s repair 
coils amazed her as they wrapped about his chest. She gently touched one, 
finding it almost warm to the touch. Unfortunetly a sharp pain in her lower 
arm caused Tavatron to pull away from the energy coils. She had forgotten 
what effect they had on a non-TM2 system. Pain.

Dinobot had repaired her using his own system one time. The pain had been 
immeasurable, but well worth her life. She often wondered if he would have 
done the same for another �bot. She had assumed at the time it had been an 
act of kindness, but then she got to know him on a more personal level, only 
to realize that kindness was not something Dinobot seemed capable of. He was 
loyal, and on occasion humorous, but most of the time he was all business.

A muffled and somewhat strained groan brought Tavatron back to reality. She 
hadn�t been here for the initial insertion, so she was unsure as to whether 
or not she could remove the tubes yet. Dinobot seemed capable of sustaining 
himself without the aid of all this equipment. Still, an uncertainty 
lingered in the back of her mind. The constant doubt and second guessing was 
beginning to unnerve her. She resisted the temptation to pull the tubes from 
Dinobot�s mouth.

Dinobot�s repair coils continued their work while Tavatron placed her hand 
on the only part of his body she could without risking exposure to the green 
coils, his face. Her fingers gently brushed his cheek as she gazed down at 
him, waiting for him to fully awaken:

"The next time you do something this stupid I�m going to kill you myself. 
Understand?"

Her voice was somewhat stern, but in a friendly and lighthearted manner. 
Right now she was relieved just to see that he was awake.
